methods.name: Query
methods.description:
Build a Query object.

Queries should be built with datastore/dataset#createQuery and run via datastore/dataset#runQuery.

methods.name: filter
methods.description:
Datastore allows querying on properties. Supported comparison operators are =, <, >, <=, and >=. "Not equal" and IN operators are currently not supported.

To filter by ancestors, see datastore/query#hasAncestor.

examples.caption: List all companies that are located in California.
List all companies named Google that have less than 400 employees.
To filter by key, use __key__ for the property name. Filter on keys stored as properties is not currently supported.
examples.code:
var key = datastore.key(['Company', 'Google']);
var keyQuery = query.filter('__key__', key);

methods.name: order
methods.description: Sort the results by a property name in ascending or descending order. By default, an ascending sort order will be used.

params.name: options.descending
params.description: • Sort the results by a property name in descending order. Default: false.

methods.name: groupBy
methods.description: Group query results by a list of properties.

methods.name: select
methods.description:
Retrieve only select properties from the matched entities.

Queries that select a subset of properties are called Projection Queries.

params.name: fieldNames
params.description: • Properties to return from the matched entities.

methods.name: start
methods.description: Set a starting cursor to a query.

methods.name: end
methods.description: Set an ending cursor to a query.

examples.code:
// Limit the results to 10 entities.
var limitQuery = companyQuery.limit(10);

params.name: n
params.description: • The number of results to limit the query to.

examples.code:
// Start from the 101st result.
var offsetQuery = companyQuery.offset(100);

params.name: n
params.description: • The offset to start from after the start cursor.
